content: Suppose s ‚àà ùìù x, then is s an open set? I just found some theorems like isOpen_iff_mem_nhds, but it seems not what I want. I want to construct an open cover by using the neighborhoods around each point in a compact set, so that I could use the finite cover theorem.

No, see docs#mem_nhds_iff - the neighborhoods of a point are sets with an opening subset containing it, but they themselves don't have to be open (for a concrete example, [0, 1] is a neighborhood of 0.5 in the reals)
